result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Raymond Wuorinen Jr.

records.addlTxt:
11:10 AM Defendant Robert Raymond Wuorinen Jr. in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Robert Raymond Wuorinen Jr.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF238, 22CF251, 22CF298, and 22CM186. In all felony cases, Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests status. 
Attorney Rosenthal notes that there is a prelim in another file, 22CF387. Attorney and client would like to waive preliminary hearing in that file. Attorney/Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Arraignment to be set on this case. Status will be set for same date on all other files.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:21 AM Defendant Robert Raymond Wuorinen Jr. in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Robert Raymond Wuorinen Jr.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendant's right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:13 AM 22CF238, 22CF251, 22CM186
Defendant Robert Raymond Wuorinen Jr. in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Robert Raymond Wuorinen Jr.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State indicates her understanding
22CF238- defendant wishes to waive.
22CF251-requesting to come back for another appearance and have a preliminary hearing on that one.

Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing on 22CF238. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for arraignment. 

Attorney agrees with State's request.
Attorney Rosenthal indicates defendant wishes to waive time limits for 22CF251

Court sets 22CF238 for argn and 22CM186 for STC.
22CF251 for adj prelim.
Arraignment scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt: Letter to commissioner re:attorney status check & request to reschedule prelim

Adjustment Number: 22A 151215,
Payable Number: 150382,
Receipt Number: 22R 010270,
Amount: $20.00
No contact with John Morro, Amanda Betcher, 1315 Birch Ave in Superior, and 1313 Belknap St (Freedom gas station).

1:56 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert Raymond Wuorinen Jr. appeared by video, in custody. Defendant's address confirmed. Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks 250 cash bail. No contact with JM, A.B, 1313 Belknap St, and not contacting the victims through social media or creating new social media accounts to contact victims.   Has violated previous no contacts in the past with different victims. Asks for $100 cash, indicates that the defendant will be retaining Attorney Rosenthal. Has family and employment in the community. Notes the defendant's medical condition. Asks for $100 cash bail.

Court orders $2000 signature bond. No contact with John Marrow, Amanda Betcher, 1315 Birch Ave in Superior, 1313 Belknap St (Freedom gas station). Court notes that social media condition that state requested is covered under the no contact condition.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
